body:
# FastTrack Ruby on Rails
This two-day intensive training gives you hands-on experience with creating data-driven website using the popular Ruby on Rails framework, and will be ready to tackle your own web project.

Starting with the Ruby and Rails basic, you will learn the full Rails MVC stack. You will work through the full life-cycle of a Rails project, giving you a first-hand experience creating a Rails app.

## Duration
2 days (November 16-17, 2013 - 9AM to 6PM)

## Venue
TBA

## Audience

This course is designed for developers with some web development experience that wish to learn Ruby on Rails and its application.

## Course Outline
By the end of the training, you will have a firm understanding of Ruby on Rails concepts like:

* MVC (Model, View, Controller) architecture
* Bundler
* Rails console
* Rake
* Creating Rake tasks
* Rails' configuration files
* Generators
* RESTful routes
* Migrations
* ActiveRecord models
* Model validations
* Model associations
* Model callbacks
* AREL
* ActionController controllers
* Filters
* Metal/Rack
* ERB based views
* HAML based views
* Rails plugins
* Unit testing

## Prerequisites
All participants of the training course must be familiar with the general principles of object oriented programming (OOP), with some exposure to the following concepts and technologies:

* Web development principles
* Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* Basic understanding of HTTP protocols (GET, POST, redirection, SSL)
* Basic knowledge of SQL
* Familiarity with relational databases (MySQL, SQLite, etc.)

## Ruby and Rails installation
Participants are encouraged to install Ruby 2.0 and Rails 4.0 prior to the training. If you need help with the installation, let us know in advance so our instructors can assist you.

## Instructors

### Diwa Del Mundo
Diwa is a seasoned IT professional with six years of professional experience as a software developer and consultant specializing in Open Source technologies. He has management experience as a business founder. Diwa has strong programming and analytical skills with leadership and team-player qualities.

Diwa previously facilitated an "Introduction to Ruby on Rails" course for the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (TESDA) of the Philippines and CATIA Foundation, Inc. The course was designed to help students gain a basic foundation of Ruby and Ruby on Rails.

### Ric Tariman, Jr.
Ric is a profilic coder, mentor and teacher, leading web development teams to successful projects deliveries. He is currently a Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer at an up-and-coming startup company serving digital entreprenuers.
